raw_comment: It's obvious that legacy applicants have a greater chance at getting a perfect sear on their college admissions steak compared to those lighting up the stove with their average admissions match. What I find most boggling is the same thing the article finds boggling: if colleges perpetuate privilege. I didn't even think this was a thing before. But this doesn't concern me too much as I don't have the brain nor dough for Harvard. That said, it is an eye-opener to learn how "unfair" it is.
ace_sentences: Legacy applicants have a greater chance of admission to a college than non-legacy applicants.
The writer compares college admission to cooking a steak.
The writer finds one issue boggling.
The issue is this: some colleges perpetuate privilege.
The article also finds this issue boggling.
Before reading, the writer did not think that this practice existed.
This issue does not concern the writer very much.
